#summary Papers in which SimpLie has been used for calculations.

Papers in which SimpLie has been used for calculations:

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0705.1304 E(11) and the Embedding Tensor] by E. Bergshoeff, I. De Baetselier, and T. Nutma.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0706.3659 Duality Symmetries and G+++ Theories] by Fabio Riccioni, Duncan Steele, and Peter West.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0711.2035 Kac-Moody Spectrum of (Half-)Maximal Supergravities] by Eric Bergshoeff, Joaquim Gomis, Teake Nutma and Diederik Roest.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0805.2573 Extended Symmetries in Supergravity: the Semi-simple Case] by Axel Kleinschmidt and Diederik Roest.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/arXiv:0806.4780 The emergence of fermions and the E11 content] by Francois Englert by Laurent Houart.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0810.5767 E10 and Gauged Maximal Supergravity] by Eric A. Bergshoeff, Olaf Hohm, Axel Kleinschmidt, Hermann Nicolai, Teake A. Nutma, and Jakob Palmkvist.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0812.4140 Infinite Sequence of Poincare Group Extensions: Structure and Dynamics] by Sotirios Bonanos and Joaquim Gomis.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/0905.4651 Finite and infinite-dimensional symmetries of pure N=2 supergravity in D=4] by Laurent Houart, Axel Kleinschmidt, Josef Lindman HÃ¶rnlund, Daniel Persson, and Nassiba Tabti.


    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/arXiv:0910.1444 Kac-Moody algebraic structures in supergravity theories] by Nassiba Tabti.

    * [http://arxiv.org/abs/arXiv:1203.5585 Half-maximal supergravity in three dimensions: supergeometry, differential forms and algebraic structure] by J. Greitz and P. S. Howe.
